Intervention.summary:
Who: Intergovernmental Affairs
What: Began a rigorous testing and monitoring program as a strategy to reduce the mandatory quarantine period of 14 days for international travellers at 2 ports of entry into Canada, the Coutts land border crossing and the Calgary International Airport in Alberta: travellers who participate will receive a COVID-19 test upon entry into Canada before proceeding into the required quarantine; once the test comes back negative, they will then be allowed to leave their place of quarantine so long as they commit to getting a second test on day 6 or 7 after arrival, at a community pharmacy participating in the pilot program
Effective until:

Who: Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada
What: Extended the $50-million Mandatory Isolation Support for Temporary Foreign Workers Program, which helps employers in the farming, fish harvesting and food production and processing sectors with some of the incremental costs incurred to support the safety and health of foreign workers during the 14-day period; under the program, the federal government will provide a maximum support of $1,500 for each temporary foreign worker, to employers who are required to isolate workers under the Quarantine Act; the funding is conditional on employers not being found in violation of the mandatory 14-day isolation protocols or any other public health order
Effective until: 2020-11-30

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Updated guidance to recommend wearing a 3-layer non-medical mask, which includes a middle, filter layer
Effective until:

Who: Indigenous Services Canada
What: Announced $120.7 million in funding to help Indigenous early learning and child care facilities safely operate during the pandemic; the investment is expected to support more than 35,000 First Nations, Inuit and Métis Nation children and assist Indigenous communities in addressing their most critical needs, including implementing enhanced cleaning protocols and hiring additional staff
Effective until:

Who: Indigenous Services Canada
What: Announced $59 million for First Nations to adapt their community infrastructure on reserve to implement public health and safety measures in community buildings by adding hand washing stations; buying hand sanitizers, personal protective equipment for staff and cleaning supplies; installing signage and barriers to promote physical distancing; and doing safety checks and upgrades to existing ventilation systems
Effective until:

Intervention..type: Financial and economic — research and development
Intervention.summary:
Who: Prime Minister
What: Making an additional investment of nearly $28 million through the COVID-19 Exceptional Opportunities Fund and the Canadian Foundation for Innovation to support 79 research projects related to the pandemic
Effective until:

Who: Public Services and Procurement Canada
What: Announced that the Government of Canada has signed an agreement with BD (Becton, Dickinson and Company) to purchase 7.6 million rapid, point-of-care, SARS-CoV-2 antigen tests for use on the BD Veritor™ Plus System and up to 2,172 analysers
Effective until:

Who: Indigenous Services Canada
What: Provided $61.4 million in immediate funding to the Manitoba First Nations Provincial Coordination Response Team and regional First Nations organizations and partners to support their pandemic response; part of the funding announced will be used to staff additional primary care nurses, public health nurses, paramedics and community workers; and immediate support to 8 on-reserve personal care homes to support the adaptation of the visitation rooms, the hiring of additional staff and the implementation of greater infection prevention and control measures; and immediate support to First Nations with active cases for perimeter security, food security and surge capacity as needed
Effective until:

Who: Indigenous Services Canada
What: Announced deployment of an additional 12 temporary structures and 3 drive-through testing sites to Manitoba First Nations in support of testing and will also provide additional support for contact tracing; will also partner with the Province of Manitoba and the Public Health Agency of Canada's National Microbiology Laboratory to support rapid testing
Effective until:

Who: Department of Finance Canada
What: Extended the Canada Emergency Wage Subsidy until June 2021; will remain at the current rate of up to 65% of eligible wages
Effective until:

Who: Indigenous Services Canada
What: Announced $2.3 million in immediate funding to support the Opaskwayak Cree Nation (located in Manitoba) community's response to the pandemic and to ensure necessary resources are in place at the Rod McGillivray Personal Care Home to address the current outbreak and prevent and reduce the spread of COVID-19. Also announced $120.37 million in immediate funding to support the response to the pandemic in Indigenous communities and organizations in Alberta ($52 million) and Saskatchewan ($68 million).This funding will provide support for vulnerable populations, support for long-term care homes, deploying additional staff in communities with outbreaks, strengthening mental health services and additional isolation and screening spaces where needed.
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Updated projections for cases and critical care cases
Effective until:

Intervention..type: Financial and economic — research and development
Intervention.summary:
Who: Health Canada
What: Authorized Bamlanivimab for use in treatment of adults and pediatric patients 12 years of age or older with mild to moderate COVID-19
Effective until:

Who: Indigenous Services Canada
What: Announced $120 million in funding to support Alberta and Saskatchewan Indigenous communities and organizations and address the increasing needs during outbreaks; allocated $68 million to Saskatchewan and $52 million to Alberta
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Announced new mandatory requirements for travellers to Canada to submit information (e.g., contact information, self-assessment, quarantine plan) pre- and post-arrival via ArriveCAN or by calling the 1-833-641-0343 toll-free number; they will not be able to revert to using ArriveCAN; travellers who do not submit the mandatory information required after they have crossed the border will be considered a high priority for follow-up by law enforcement
Effective until:

Who: Government of Canada
What: Announced $19.36 million in immediate funding to support the Government of Nunavut, Inuit communities and Inuit organizations in their response to the pandemic; this funding will support immediate needs and protection measures to help limit further spread in the region and also support the emergency response and preparedness plans in place
Effective until:

Who: Indigenous Services Canada
What: Announced $19.36 million in funding to support the Government of Nunavut, Inuit communities and Inuit organizations in their response to the pandemic
Effective until:

Who: Indigenous Services Canada
What: Launched the Alberta Indigenous Virtual Care Clinic offering health care services virtually
Effective until:

Who: Government of Canada
What: Signed an agreement with Moderna to buy an additional 20 million doses of its COVID-19 vaccine, bringing the total contract to 40 million doses
Effective until:

Who: Health Canada
What: Authorized the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine for use in people 16 years of age and older
Effective until:

Who: Health Canada
What: Announced that the COVID Alert app has been updated with 2 new features: the first update allows users to clear the screen that indicates exposure to COVID-19 (after receiving a negative COVID-19 test result, the screen can be cleared enabling the app to alert the user of a new exposure); the second feature allows users to turn COVID Alert on and off without disabling Bluetooth
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Updated projections for cases and critical care cases
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Released priority populations for vaccination in accordance with preliminary National Advisory Committee on Immunization recommendations: in Stage 1, prioritized residents and staff of shared living settings who provide care for seniors, adults 70 years of age and older, health care workers who have direct contact with patients and those who work in health care settings and adults in Indigenous communities; in Stage 2, prioritized health care workers not included in the initial rollout, residents and staff of all other congregate settings (e.g., quarters for migrant workers, correctional facilities, homeless shelters) and essential workers
Effective until:

Who: Department of Finance Canada
What: Announced increase of the maximum wage subsidy rate to 75% 
Effective until: 2021-03-13

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Suspended all flights for 72 hours from the United Kingdom in response to the emergence of a new genetic variant of the COVID-19 virus
Effective until: 2020-12-23

Who: Health Canada
What: Authorized the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine for use in people 18 years of age and older
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Extended suspension of all flights from the United Kingdom for an additional 14 days
Effective until: 2021-01-06

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Announced all travellers who have been in United Kingdom and South Africa within the period of 14 days before the day on which they seek entry into Canada will be subject to secondary screening and enhanced measures, including increased scrutiny of quarantine plans; this is in response to the emergence of new COVID-19 variants in these regions
Effective until:

Who: Transport Canada
What: Announced all air passengers 5 years of age or older will be required to have a negative COVID-19 test before travelling into Canada and will be required to have this proof in hand at time of boarding; tests must be a COVID-19 molecular test (e.g., PCR or LAMP) and be taken within 72 hours of the traveller’s scheduled departure to Canada
Effective until:

Who: Correctional Services of Canada
What: Announced vaccination of about 600 older, medically vulnerable federal inmates as recommended by the National Advisory Committee on Immunization
Effective until:

Who: Government of Canada
What: Released interim guidance for infection prevention and control in acute settings; includes guidelines for health care worker safety and training and infection prevention and control measures
Effective until:

Who: Government of Canada
What: Signed an agreement with Pfizer to buy an additional 20 million doses of its COVID-19 vaccine, bringing the contract to a total of up to of 76 million doses
Effective until:

Who: Government of Canada
What: Released webinar and guidance documents on COVID-19 vaccines for health care providers; includes requirements for handling, storage and safely providing the COVID-19 vaccine
Effective until:

Intervention..type: Financial and economic — research and development
Intervention.summary:
Who: Canadian Institutes of Health Research
What: Invested $1 million to support the COVID-19 Evidence Network, which will bring together experts to collaborate and rapidly synthesize the best available evidence across the full breadth of Canada's COVID-19 pandemic response
Effective until:

Who: Indigenous Services Canada
What: Announced $186.8 million over 2 years to support the needs and gaps in long-term care facilities, and to provide additional home care in Indigenous communities
Effective until: 2023-01

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Updated projections for cases and critical care cases
Effective until:

Who: Government of Canada
What: Extended the temporary travel restrictions for all non-US travellers, unless their travel is for non-discretionary reasons
Effective until: 2021-02-21

Who: Government of Canada
What: Extended the temporary travel restrictions for US travellers, unless their travel is for non-discretionary reasons
Effective until: 2021-02-21

Who: Public Services and Procurement Canada
What: Deployed 2 federal Mobile Health Units (MHU), in response to a provincial request for assistance to help relieve pressure on Ontario's strained hospital capacity 
Effective until: 2021-05-01

Who: House of Commons
What: Members of the House of Commons may participate in House proceedings either in person or by video conference
Effective until: 2021-06-23

Who: Transport Canada
What: Suspended all flights to and from Mexico and Caribbean countries
Effective until: 2021-04-30

Who: House of Commons
What: Announced mask requirement in the House of Commons for any person, including members and their staff, political research office employees, administration employees, members of the Parliamentary Press Gallery and parliamentary business visitors
Effective until: 2021-06-23

Who: Prime Minister
What: Announced that all international passenger flights must land either at the Vancouver, Calgary, Toronto or Montréal airports
Effective until:

Who: Transport Canada
What: Pleasure craft vessels prohibited in all Canadian waters
Effective until: 2022-02-28

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Released vaccine toolkit for health care professionals, including guidance for managing vaccination clinics and administering vaccines
Effective until:

Who: Government of Canada
What: Extended the temporary travel restrictions for all non-US travellers, unless their travel is for non-discretionary reasons
Effective until: 2021-04-21

Who: Government of Canada
What: Extended the temporary travel restrictions for US travellers, unless their travel is for non-discretionary reasons
Effective until: 2021-03-21

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Announced that all travellers arriving in Canada by land will be required to provide proof of a negative COVID-19 molecular test result taken in the United States within 72 hours of pre-arrival, or a proof of a positive test result within 14 and 90 days prior to arrival
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Updated projections for cases and critical care cases
Effective until:

Who: Prime Minister
What: Extended the Canada Recovery Benefit and the Canada Recovery Caregiving Benefit for an additional 12 weeks
Effective until: 2021-05-14

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Announced that all travellers, with some exceptions, will be required to take a COVID-19 molecular test when they arrive in Canada before exiting the airport or crossing the border, and another at the end of their 14-day quarantine period; additionally, travellers will be required to submit their travel, contact information and suitable quarantine plan electronically via ArriveCAN before crossing the border or boarding a flight
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Announced that all travellers arriving by air, with limited exceptions, will be required to reserve a 3-night stay in a government-authorized hotel at their own cost while they await the results of their arrival test
Effective until:

Who: Health Canada
What: Authorized the AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine for use in people 18 years of age and older
Effective until:

Who: Health Canada
What: Authorized the COVIDSHIELD (manufactured by Serum Institute of India) vaccine for use in people 18 years of age and older
Effective until:

Who: Public Services and Procurement Canada
What: Announced that 2 million doses of the AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine have been secured
Effective until:

Who: National Advisory Committee on Immunization
What: Approved revised recommendations to defer 2nd dose of COVID-19 vaccines
Effective until:

Who: Department of Finance Canada
What: Maintained the Canada Emergency Wage Subsidy and Rent Subsidy rates
Effective until: 2021-06-05

Who: Health Canada
What: Authorized the Johnson & Johnson (Janssen Inc.) vaccine for use in people 18 years of age and older
Effective until:

Who: Employment and Social Development Canada
What: Announced that workers claiming benefits from the Employment Insurance program, between 2020-09-27 and 20201-09-25, are able to access up to a maximum of 50 weeks of benefits
Effective until: 2021-09-25

Who: Government of Canada
What: Extended the temporary travel restrictions for US travellers, unless their travel is for non-discretionary reasons
Effective until: 2021-04-21

Who: Indigenous Services Canada
What: Deployed Canadian Armed Forces to accelerate the pace of immunization in northern Manitoba communities 
Effective until: 2021-06-30

Intervention..type: Financial and economic — research and development
Intervention.summary:
Who: Canadian Institutes of Health Research
What: $14.3 million allocated to support new research on the COVID-19 virus variants 
Effective until:

Who: Health Canada, National Advisory Committee on Immunization
What: Issued additional terms and condition for the authorization of the AstraZeneca and Verity Pharmaceuticals/Serum Institute of India vaccines
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Updated projections for cases and critical care cases
Effective until:

Who: National Advisory Committee on Immunization
What: Recommended immediate pause in the use of the AstraZeneca vaccine in Canada for those under 55; product monograph to be updated to provide information on very rare reports of blood clots associated with low levels of blood platelets
Effective until:

Who: Canadian Northern Economic Development Agency
What: Announced $143,000 in funding for Pauktuutit Inuit Women of Canada, which supports women entrepreneurs across Inuit Nunangat, to navigate the crisis and continue to grow their business
Effective until:

What: Announced $1.5 million for a Safe Voluntary Isolation Site for Thunder Bay and surrounding communities
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Announced $17.8 million for a Safe Voluntary Isolation Site for temporary foreign agri-workers in Windsor-Essex
Effective until:

Who: Government of Canada                             What: Announced $70 million funding to the Canadian Red Cross to build and maintain capacity to support deployment for crisis management activities and for COVID-19 testing-related activities
Effective until:

Who: Health Canada
What: Announced investment in StaySafe rapid screening program in Waterloo region; 3 COVID-19 rapid screening buses will provide free testing for various workplaces
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Announced $11.6 million for a Safe Voluntary Isolation site in Saskatchewan
Effective until:

Who: Public Safety Canada
What: Provided a 2-month extension on the 2 federal Mobile Health Units provided to Ontario in 2021-01
Effective until: 2021-06-30

Who: Prime Minister
What: Deployed essential biomedical equipment, including Cardiohelp systems, AirVo oxygen units, high-flow nasal oxygen devices and extracorporeal membrane oxygenation machines to support Ontario's health care system
Effective until:

Intervention..type: Financial and economic — research and development
Intervention.summary:
Who: Government of Canada
What: Released 2021 Budget "A Recovery Plan for Jobs, Growth, and Resilience," which includes projected funding over the coming years regarding the end of the pandemic and recovery post-pandemic
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Extended the temporary travel restrictions for US travellers, unless their travel is for non-discretionary reasons
Effective until: 2021-05-21

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Extended the temporary travel restrictions for all non-US travellers, unless their travel is for non-discretionary reasons
Effective until: 2021-05-21

Who: Prime Minister
What: Suspended all direct passenger flights from Pakistan and India entering Canada for 30 days. Also, passengers departing from India or Pakistan who arrive to Canada via indirect routes will need to obtain a negative COVID-19 pre-departure test from the last country they travelled through before arriving in Canada. These measures are in addition to the enhanced measures already in place.
Effective until: 2021-05-21

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Updated projections for cases and critical care cases
Effective until:

Who: Government of Canada
What: Announced the deployment of federal health human resources, support from the Canadian Armed Forces (CAF) and funding for the redeployment of the Canadian Red Cross to augment or relieve staff within medical care facilities in Ontario; in addition, the CAF will airlift medical personnel from Newfoundland and Labrador and possibly other jurisdictions to Ontario
Effective until:

Who: Public Services and Procurement Canada
What: Signed an agreement with Dynacare to provide temporary foreign workers arriving at Montréal-Trudeau International Airport services for appointment booking, test administration and results management, including mobile services for on-site specimen collection for the 2nd test required on the 8th day of quarantine
Effective until:

Who: Prime Minister
What: Deployed 60 Canadian Armed Forces members to testing centres in Nova Scotia to assist as cases rise 
Effective until:

Who: National Advisory Committee on Immunization
What: Recommended that the Janssen COVID-19 vaccine be offered to individuals 30 and older without contraindications
Effective until:

Who: Health Canada
What: Authorized the use of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine in children 12 to 15
Effective until:

Who: Indigenous Services Canada
What: Activated Canadian Rangers and the Canadian Armed Forces in the Moose Cree First Nation and the Neskantaga First Nation to provide assistance with COVID-19 response efforts in the communities
Effective until:

Who: Indigenous Services Canada
What: Announced that the Government of Canada is providing more than $19 million in additional and immediate support to the Government of Nunavut and Nunavut Tunngavik Incorporated through a combination of new and expanded federal transfers or in-kind spending
Effective until:

Who: Government of Canada, Employment and Social Development Canada
What: Announced $2.3 million to help internationally trained nurses get certified and find jobs
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Launched new campaign to encourage vaccine uptake through television, radio, print, out-of-home and online
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Extended the temporary travel restrictions for all US travellers, unless their travel is for non-discretionary reasons
Effective until: 2021-06-21

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Extended the temporary travel restrictions for all non-US travellers, unless their travel is for non-discretionary reasons
Effective until: 2021-06-21

Who: Public Safety Canada
What: Deployed federal health human resources and medical staff through the Canadian Red Cross and the Canadian Armed Forces to support the pandemic response in Manitoba 
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Announced $4.2 million to operate safe voluntary isolation sites in Nova Scotia
Effective until:

Who: Infrastructure Canada
What: Invested over $11.4 million in projects to support health care and long-term care infrastructure projects throughout Nova Scotia as part of the COVID-19 Resilience Stream of the Investing in Canada Infrastructure 
Effective until:

Who: Health Canada
What: Approved an extension to 2 lots (MT0055 and MT0056) of the AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine expiry dates, from 2021-05-31 to 2021-07-01 to allow provinces and territories to use up their existing inventory
Effective until:

Who: Government of Canada
What: Announced Canadian Red Cross support to Nunavut at the Mary River Mine on Baffin Island for contact tracing in response to a COVID-19 variant outbreak
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada, National Advisory Committee on Immunization
What: Updated guidance on mixed vaccine procedures: now allows a person who received a 1st dose of a viral vector vaccine (e.g., AstraZeneca) to choose to receive a 2nd dose of either a viral vector vaccine or an mRNA vaccine
Effective until:

Who: Department of Finance Canada
What: Extended the Canada Emergency Wage Subsidy for an additional 3 months
Effective until:

Intervention..type: Financial and economic — research and development
Intervention.summary:
Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Announced $25,000 awarded to 20 finalists participating in the Vaccine Community Innovation Challenge to develop and launch their projects to increase people's confidence in COVID-19 vaccines and reinforce public health measures in their communities
Effective until:

Intervention..type: Financial and economic — research and development
Intervention.summary:
Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Announced the funding of 5 projects (4 provincial and 1 national) through the Immunization Partnership Fund to support vaccination uptake among populations disproportionately impacted by COVID-19 across Canada by increasing COVID-19 vaccine knowledge and access
Effective until:

Who: Infrastructure Canada
What: Invested over $6.3 million in projects to support upgrades to 4 public facilities in eastern Prince Edward Island as part of the COVID-19 Resilience Infrastructure stream of the Investing in Canada Infrastructure program
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Announced $731,810 in funding to the Simcoe Muskoka District Health Unit to operate safe voluntary isolation sites in Barrie, Ontario, and surrounding communities
Effective until:

Who: Government of Canada
What: Announced $9.3 million to support distress centres across Canada during the pandemic, including to support recruiting and training; this is part of a $50 million investment announced earlier during the COVID-19 pandemic 
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada 
What: Launched the "Ask the Experts" campaign series that features short videos of trusted experts answering common questions about COVID-19 vaccines
Effective until:

Who: Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada
What: Announced that any foreign national who holds a valid Confirmation of Permanent Residence is allowed to travel to Canada; travellers must still follow all requirement checklists for entering the country
Effective until:

Who: Government of Canada
What: Extended the temporary travel restrictions for all non-US travellers, unless their travel is for non-discretionary reasons
Effective until: 2021-07-21

Who: Government of Canada
What: Extended the temporary travel restrictions for all US travellers, unless their travel is for non-discretionary reasons 
Effective until: 2021-07-21

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Allocated funding to the Dr. Peter Centre to develop a bilingual national community of practice to help community health agencies improve uptake and access to COVID-19 vaccines for people living with HIV and other complex health and social conditions through the creation of an online portal of resources
Effective until:

Intervention..type: Financial and economic — research and development
Intervention.summary:
Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Announced the funding of 4 projects through the Immunization Partnership Fund to support vaccination uptake among populations disproportionately impacted by COVID-19 through targeted outreach and culturally relevant interventions
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Announced the easing of travel restrictions for fully vaccinated travellers who fall under the "eligible to enter" categories; in addition, all travellers required to disclose vaccination status information in the ArriveCAN app 
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Eased travel restrictions for fully vaccinated travellers who fall under the "eligible to enter" categories; those permitted to enter no longer required to quarantine or take a COVID-19 test on day 8
Effective until:

Who: Public Safety Canada
What: Approved federal assistance to the Government of Yukon due to the outbreaks in Whitehorse and other communities; Public Safety Canada, Public Health Agency of Canada, Health Canada and Indigenous Services Canada are working with the Government of Yukon to send more public health professionals to help with coordination, contact tracing and social supports, as well as to ship laboratory equipment and personal protective equipment
Effective until:

Who: Public Safety Canada, Public Health Agency of Canada, Health Canada, Indigenous Services Canada
What: Announced federal support to Yukon by offering to send health and social services professionals to support the territory's COVID-19 efforts
Effective until:

Intervention..type: Financial and economic — research and development
Intervention.summary:
Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Announced the funding of 2 projects to encourage COVID-19 vaccination in youth through the Immunization Partnership Fund to promote the importance of vaccinating for youth age 12 and older
Effective until:

Who: Office of the Prime Minister
What: Received more than 66 million doses of the COVID-19 vaccine, enough to fully vaccinate every eligible Canadian—2 months ahead of schedule
Effective until:

Who: Office of the Deputy Prime Minister
What: Extended the eligibility period for the Canada Emergency Wage Subsidy, the Canada Emergency Rent Subsidy and Lockdown Support and increased the amount of support that can be received during the period between 2021-08-23 and 2021-09025
Effective until: 2021-10-23

Who: Government of Canada                                 What: Announced $15 million funding for Newfoundland and Labrador's long-term care sector to enhance infection prevention and control measures including an increase in human resources capacity and safety
Effective until:

Who: Transport Canada
What: Extended the Notice to Airmen that restricts all direct commercial and private passenger flights to Canada from India
Effective until: 2021-09-21

Intervention.summary:

What: Announced an agreement with Moderna to build mRNA vaccine facility in Canada to support the development of vaccines for the current and future pandemics

What: Announced funding for research on possible adverse events following the COVID-19 vaccine
Effective until:

What: Announced funding for Canada's major airports to increase testing and screening infrastructure for COVID-19 to aid in the restart of air travel

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Approved funding for COVID-19 safe voluntary isolation sites in Ontario to help people who have COVID-19 have access to safe isolation accommodations

Who: Government of Canada                        What: Announced $3 million funding for Yukon's long-term care sector to support hiring new staff and ensuring adequate supply of personal protective equipment
Effective until:

Who: Government of Canada                                 What: Announced $134 million funding for British Columbia's long-term care sector to enhance infection prevention and control measures including an increase in human resources capacity and safety                                                   Effective until:

Who: Canada Border Services Agency
What: Resumed service at various small marine reporting sites, airports of entry and ferry terminals; the openings vary by region and will have new sites opening 2021-09-06 and 2021-09-19
Effective until:

Who: Transport Canada
What: Issued a Notice to Airmen due to the latest public health advice from the Public Health Agency of Canada, restricting all direct commercial and private passenger flights to Canada from Morocco
Effective until:

Who: Health Canada
What: Announced that Ivermectin is not an authorized treatment for COVID-19 and warned that the drug can cause serious health issues

Who: Canada Border Services Agency
What: Announced that fully vaccinated foreign nationals are eligible to enter Canada for non-essential reasons
Effective until:

Who: National Advisory Committee on Immunization
What: Provided updated advice for immunocompromised individuals to include an additional dose following the 1- or 2-dose series

What: Authorized new names for the Pfizer-BioNTech, Moderna and AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccines
Effective until:

What: Extended the Notice to Airmen to continue restrictions for all direct commercial and private passenger flights to Canada from India
Effective until: 2021-09-26

What: Announced that the Canadian Armed Forces and the Canadian Red Cross are sending critical care nurses to Alberta to assist 
Effective until:

What: Announced that those in the federal workforce and federally regulated transportation sectors will be required to be vaccinated against COVID-19
Effective until:

What: Extended the Red Cross support being sent to Ontario long-term care and retirement homes
Effective until: 2021-11-30

What: Announced Canadian Red Cross support for the N.W.T. to assist in infection prevention and control, contact tracing and COVID-19 testing efforts

What: Announced a standardization of COVID-19 proof of vaccination for all provinces and territories
Effective until:

What: Extended various COVID-19 support measures including the Canada Emergency Wage Subsidy, Canada Emergency Rent Subsidy, Lockdown Support and Canada Recovery Hiring Program

What: Authorized the use of the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine as a booster shot

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Announced funding for COVID-19 safe voluntary isolation sites in B.C.
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Implemented enhanced border measures for all travellers who have been in the southern Africa region within the last 14 days; foreign nationals who have travelled to the region in the last 14 days will not be permitted entry into Canada; Canadian citizens, permanent residents and those with status under the Indian Act will be subject to enhanced testing, screening and quarantine measures

What: Announced that all travellers coming from the southern Africa region are required to complete a 14-day quarantine
Effective until: 2022-01-31

Who: Transport Canada
What: Announced the opening of additional airports to receive international passengers
Effective until:

Who: Transport Canada
What: Elimination of COVID-19 testing for fully vaccinated individuals departing and entering the country within 72 hours; expanded the list of accepted vaccines for the purpose of travel; valid COVID-19 tests no longer accepted as an alternative to vaccination for travel within Canada; new requirements for all exempt essential travellers, including the mandate to identify their vaccination status in ArriveCAN
Effective until:

Who: Public Services and Procurement Canada
What: Announced an agreement between Merck and Pfizer for access to their COVID-19 oral antiviral treatments
Effective until:

Who: Employment and Social Development Canada
What: Announced that all employees in federally regulated industries are required to be vaccinated
Effective until:

Who: Health Canada
What: Announced a Canada-Quebec agreement for virtual health care services in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic; through this agreement, Quebec is receiving more than $28 million to expand its virtual health care services
Effective until:

Who: Employment and Social Development Canada
What: Approved amendment to Canada's Criminal Code to enhance protection of health care workers, those who assist them and those accessing health care services; offenders punishable by a maximum penalty of 10 years imprisonment on indictment; amendment addresses the worsening of violence and threats directed at health care workers during the COVID-19 pandemic
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Lifted the extraordinary measures for travellers returning from Botswana, Egypt, Eswatini, Lesotho, Malawi, Mozambique, Namibia, Nigeria, South Africa and Zimbabwe
Effective until:

Who: Public Services and Procurement Canada
What: Announced the procurement of 1.136 million doses of the Pfizer-BioNTech pediatric vaccine
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Reinstated the requirement for a pre-arrival negative PCR test for all travellers arriving in Canada from a trip of any duration; exception for residents of B.C. who are travelling to the US by land to purchase goods and services and who are absent from Canada for no more than 24 hours
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Announced funding for COVID-19 safe voluntary isolation sites in Man.
Effective until:

Who: Public Safety Canada
What: Announced that the Government of Canada will provide of up to 24 Canadian Red Cross personnel to support N.S.'s COVID-19 immunization program
Effective until:

Who: Transport Canada
What: Announced that certain groups who are currently exempt from entry requirements will only be allowed to enter the country if they are fully vaccinated
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Announced that unvaccinated or partially vaccinated foreign national truck drivers, coming to Canada from the US by land, will not be allowed entry
Effective until:

Who: Health Canada
What: Authorized the use of Paxlovid for patients with mild to moderate COVID-19 at high risk of developing serious diseases
Effective until:

Who: Transport Canada
What: Removed pre-departure test for travellers coming to Canada on direct or indirect flights from India or Morocco
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Recommends those 5 to 11 receive a complete 2-dose primary series of Pfizer pediatric mRNA COVID-19 vaccine; for those 12 to 17, a complete primary series of authorized mRNA COVID-19 vaccines
Effective until:

Who: Health Canada
What: Introduced Bill C-10 - An Act respecting certain measures related to COVID-19 in Parliament to provide Health Canada with the statutory authority to purchase and distribute across the country up to $2.5 billion worth of COVID-19 rapid tests
Effective until:

Who: Transport Canada
What: Ended the temporary exemption from pre-entry, arrival and day-8 testing and quarantine requirements for residents and essential workers of B.C. who have to travel by land to or through the US for essential food and supplies
Effective until:

Who: Inuit Tapiriit Kanatami
What: Called for air transportation to be designated as an essential service in Inuit Nunangat for the duration of the COVID-19 response, as the airline travel routes are the sole entry points for food, medicine and other essential supplies in all but 2 of 51 Inuit communities, and a critical means of travel for patients requiring advanced medical treatment
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Issued an updated order under which any traveller arriving in Canada — whether they are symptomatic or asymptomatic — cannot isolate or quarantine in a place where they would be in contact with people who are vulnerable, such as adults aged 65 years or over and people with pre-existing medical conditions
Effective until:

Who: Prime Minister
What: Announced additional support to address immediate health, economic and transportation needs in the North (governments of Yukon, the Northwest Territories and Nunavut): $72.6 million to support COVID-19 health and social services preparations and response; $17.3 million to support northern air carriers; $15 million in non-repayable support for businesses; an additional $25 million to Nutrition North Canada
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Launched a dedicated government web page for COVID-19
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Released an interim national case definition for the novel coronavirus (earliest publication date tracked using Internet Archive)
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Issued guidance to major event planners to conduct a risk assessment when considering public health actions related to mass gatherings. The guidelines offer mitigation strategies, such as limiting the number of people at an event, offering virtual or live-stream activities, staggering arrivals and departures, and making more hand-washing stations available. 
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Instructions provided in fact sheet on how to self-isolate for those diagnosed with COVID-19: "You must isolate yourself for at least 14 days if you have symptoms of COVID-19, even if mild" (earliest publication date tracked using Internet Archive)
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Published fact sheet on how to self-isolate for those diagnosed with COVID-19 
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Published fact sheet on how to self-isolate for those who may have been exposed and have no symptoms
Effective until:

Who: Government of Canada
What: Activated the federal/provincial/territorial health response plan for biologic events 
Effective until:

Who: Canadian Psychological Association
What: Published guidelines for psychologists for virtual care options that ensure continuity of care for clients
Effective until:

Intervention..type: Financial and economic — research and development
Intervention.summary:
Who: Prime Minister
What: Announced more than $1 billion in support of a national medical research strategy to fight COVID-19 that includes vaccine development, the production of treatments and tracking of the virus
Effective until:

Who: Prime Minister
What: Announced the upcoming launch of a new nationwide mobile app to provide notifications of exposure to COVID-19 across Canada; the app will be available to Canadians for free download, with health authorities in Ontario being the first to distribute the unique, temporary codes to people who test positive for COVID-19 
Effective until:

Intervention..type: Financial and economic — research and development
Intervention.summary:
Who: Public Services and Procurement Canada
What: Announced that the Government of Canada has signed an agreement with Eli Lilly for an initial order of up to 26,000 doses of its COVID-19 monoclonal antibody therapy Bamlanivimab (LY-CoV555)
Effective until:

Who: Employment and Social Development Canada
What: Announced additional support for children and families through the Canada Child Benefit with a proposed new temporary support of up to $1,200 per child under the age of 6 to further assist families with young children
Effective until:

Who: Indigenous Services Canada
What: Allocated an additional $380 million for the Indigenous Community Support Fund, which will ensure continued critical support for on-the-ground, community-led solutions to prevent, prepare for and respond to COVID-19
Effective until:

Who: Government of Canada
What: Announced $23.2 million in funding to develop and implement an accelerated program to train 4,000 new personal support worker interns; program will be offered at no cost to the trainees
Effective until:

Intervention..type: Financial and economic — research and development
Intervention.summary:
Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Announced an investment of $53 million in research to increase the understanding of emerging variants and provide guidance to decision-makers for drug therapy, vaccine effectiveness and other public health strategies
Effective until:

Who: Public Services and Procurement Canada
What: Announced accelerated delivery schedule for Pfizer-BioNTech's COVID-19 vaccine: 2.8 million doses will be received between Apr. and Jun. and an additional 6.2 million doses between Jul. and Sept.
Effective until:

Intervention..type: Financial and economic — research and development
Intervention.summary:
Who: Prime Minister
What: Announced an investment of up to $25.1 million to Precision NanoSystems Incorporated (PNI) to expand ability to produce ribonucleic acid vaccines and future genetic medicines
Effective until:

Intervention..type: Financial and economic — research and development
Intervention.summary:
Who: Prime Minister
What: Announced an investment of up to $14 million to Edesa Biotech Inc., to advance work on a monoclonal antibody therapy for acute respiratory distress syndrome, which is the leading cause of COVID-19 deaths
Effective until:

Who: Prime Minister
What: Use of the CDL Rapid Screening Consortium to complete tests at workplaces; 26 sites with 12 employers across the country and more than 5,000 screening tests completed
Effective until:

Who: Prime Minister
What: Announced that the Canadian Rangers will help with the vaccination effort in Newfoundland and Labrador
Effective until: 2021-03-31

Who: Health Canada
What: Established the Critical Drug Reserve to reserve drugs that hospitals rely on to treat patients who are critically ill with COVID-19 and are at risk of shortage 
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Announced $336,000 for a Safe Voluntary Isolation Site in Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario
Effective until:

Intervention..type: Financial and economic — research and development
Intervention.summary:
Who: Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada
What: Funded $59.2 million to the University of Saskatchewan's Vaccine and Infectious Disease Organization (VIDO) to support the development of its COVID-19 vaccine candidates and expand the research facility
Effective until:

Who: Prime Minister
What: Signed an agreement with Pfizer for 35 million booster doses for the next year and 30 million in the year after; this deal includes options to add 30 million doses in both 2022 and 2023 and an option for 60 million doses in 2024
Effective until:

Intervention..type: Financial and economic — research and development
Intervention.summary:
Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Announced an investment of $2.25 million for 2 projects, ScienceUp First and CARD (C-Comfort, A-Ask, R-Relax, D-Distract) System, to support vaccination efforts. The projects support vaccine uptake by providing access to credible information and equipping health care providers and Canadians with proven strategies to manage pain and fear during vaccination. 
Effective until:

Who: Infrastructure Canada
What: Announced collaboration between Canada and Ontario governments to fund $656.5 million to provide critical infrastructure upgrades to protect students and staff from COVID-19 in the province’s schools
Effective until:

Who: Infrastructure Canada
What: Announced collaboration between Canada and Nova Scotia governments to fund $7 million to create outdoor learning spaces for all public Nova Scotia elementary schools to promote healthy habits for students and help reduce risk of COVID-19 transmission
Effective until:

Who: Infrastructure Canada
What: Announced funding for 5 projects that will result in the installation of modular school classrooms for schools in the Halifax Regional Municipality in response to the impact of COVID-19
Effective until:

Who: Indigenous Services Canada
What: Announced $291,173 to support the Prince George Nechako Aboriginal Employment and Training Association to help provide necessary pandemic supports to at-risk urban Indigenous people
Effective until:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Released guidelines for safety measures needed (e.g., masks, distancing) depending on activity, setting and vaccination status.
Effective until:
